snippet: A foreign force that includes hundreds of South Africans is now fighting the Islamist group, officials said. Separately, the Islamic State accepted Boko Haram’s pledge of allegiance.
abstract: Hundreds of mercenaries from South Africa and other countries reportedly join Nigeria's fight against Islamist radical group Boko Haram.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, Norimitsu Onishi from Montreal, and Rukmini Callimachi from Portland, Ore.

lead_paragraph: A foreign force that includes hundreds of South Africans is now fighting the Islamist group, officials said. Separately, the Islamic State accepted Boko Haram’s pledge of allegiance.

headline.main: Mercenaries Join Nigeria’s Military Campaign Against Boko Haram
headline.print_headline: Mercenaries Join Fight Against Boko Haram
